synsets.definition: A profound state where one's emotional heart has 'died' - complete withdrawal from joy, passion, and emotional investment in life; deeper than depression, indicating spiritual death while physically alive
synsets.cultural_note: Chinese concept emphasizing the heart as seat of emotion; represents complete hedonic shutdown beyond Western anhedonia

synsets.definition: State of having an completely emptied heart/mind, where all emotional responsiveness and capacity for joy has been drained away; hollowed-out inner self
synsets.cultural_note: Japanese conception of kokoro (heart-mind unity) being completely vacated of feeling and pleasure-seeking capacity

synsets.definition: Death of the emotional heart-mind where one can no longer connect with jeong (warm feelings) or experience pleasure in relationships and life
synsets.cultural_note: Korean concept where the capacity for jeong and emotional warmth dies, leaving one unable to feel pleasure or connection

synsets.definition: Complete destruction of one's capacity for ānanda (divine bliss/joy); spiritual numbness where the soul cannot experience pleasure or divine connection
synsets.cultural_note: Hindu concept where the fundamental spiritual capacity for bliss is destroyed, representing hedonic death at the soul level

synsets.definition: State where one's capacity for iṉpam (pleasure, joy, beauty appreciation) has completely vanished, leaving emotional and aesthetic numbness
synsets.cultural_note: Tamil concept emphasizing loss of aesthetic and sensual pleasure capacity, central to Tamil emotional philosophy

synsets.definition: Condition where the heart (emotional center) has died, unable to feel joy, warmth, or kreng jai; complete emotional flatness and pleasure-seeking shutdown
synsets.cultural_note: Thai concept where the jai (heart-mind) becomes dead to all positive emotions and considerate feelings

synsets.definition: State where the hati (heart-liver emotional center) has died, losing capacity for communal joy, gotong royong spirit, and life pleasure
synsets.cultural_note: Indonesian concept where the hati (seat of emotion) dies, preventing participation in communal joy and shared human experience

synsets.definition: Spiritual condition where the heart has died to all joy, beauty, and divine pleasure; unable to experience the sweetness of faith or worldly delights
synsets.cultural_note: Islamic concept of spiritual heart-death where one loses capacity for both divine and worldly pleasure

synsets.definition: State where the del (emotional heart) has died, losing capacity for Persian concepts of joy, beauty appreciation, and poetic pleasure in life
synsets.cultural_note: Persian concept emphasizing loss of capacity for aesthetic and emotional pleasure central to Persian culture

synsets.definition: Condition where the lev (heart) is dead to joy, unable to participate in simcha (joy) or feel connection to life's pleasures and community celebration
synsets.cultural_note: Hebrew concept where the heart dies to communal joy and life celebration, central to Jewish emotional experience

synsets.definition: State where the moyo (heart) has died, losing ubuntu connection and capacity to feel communal joy and shared human pleasure
synsets.cultural_note: Swahili concept where heart-death prevents ubuntu experience and communal emotional participation

synsets.definition: Condition where the ọkàn (heart-mind) has died, unable to feel joy in community, music, celebration, or spiritual connection with orisha
synsets.cultural_note: Yoruba concept where the emotional center dies to communal and spiritual joy, fundamental to Yoruba worldview

synsets.definition: State where the čhaŋté (heart-spirit) has died, unable to feel connection to mitakuye oyasin or experience joy in sacred relations with all beings
synsets.cultural_note: Lakota concept where spiritual heart dies, preventing sacred joy and connection to all relations

synsets.definition: State where the spirit becomes deeply sick, unable to feel connection to country, dreamtime, or experience joy in cultural and natural harmony
synsets.cultural_note: Aboriginal Australian concept where spiritual connection to country and culture dies, preventing traditional joy

synsets.definition: Deep disenchantment where one loses capacity to feel saudade, joy in relationships, or pleasure in life's beauty; complete emotional flattening
synsets.cultural_note: Brazilian Portuguese concept deeper than disillusionment - complete loss of emotional and aesthetic capacity

synsets.definition: State where the yōllōtl (heart-soul) dies, losing capacity to feel joy in community, nature, and spiritual connection to ancestors
synsets.cultural_note: Nahuatl concept where the heart-soul dies to communal and spiritual joy fundamental to indigenous Mesoamerican experience

synsets.definition: State where the sems (mind-heart) becomes dead to all pleasure, compassion, and capacity for joy, even in dharma practice
synsets.cultural_note: Tibetan Buddhist concept where mind-heart dies even to spiritual pleasure and compassionate joy

synsets.definition: Condition where the puso (heart) has died, unable to feel kapwa (shared identity) joy or pleasure in community and relationships
synsets.cultural_note: Filipino concept where heart dies to kapwa connection and communal joy central to Filipino social experience

synsets.definition: State where the lòng (inner heart) has died, losing capacity for family joy, ancestor connection, and pleasure in cultural harmony
synsets.cultural_note: Vietnamese concept where inner emotional heart dies to family joy and cultural pleasure fundamental to Vietnamese life

lemmas: ចិត្តស្លាប់
synsets.definition: State where the chet (mind-heart) becomes dead, unable to feel joy in Buddhist practice, family, or community celebration
synsets.cultural_note: Khmer concept where mind-heart dies to both spiritual and communal forms of joy in Cambodian culture

synsets.definition: Condition where the sonqo (heart-spirit) dies, losing connection to Pachamama and capacity for joy in community and natural cycles
synsets.cultural_note: Quechua concept where spiritual heart dies to both earthly and community joy central to Andean worldview

synsets.definition: State where the ngākau (heart-mind) becomes mate (dead/defeated), unable to feel joy in whakapapa connections or mauri life force
synsets.cultural_note: Māori concept where heart-mind dies to genealogical joy and life force connection fundamental to Māori identity

synsets.definition: State where the leb (heart) has exited, leaving one unable to feel joy in community, coffee ceremony, or cultural celebration
synsets.cultural_note: Ethiopian Amharic concept where heart exits the body, preventing cultural and communal joy experiences

synsets.definition: Condition where the uunaq (heart-life) has died, unable to feel joy in land connection, community sharing, or seasonal celebrations
synsets.cultural_note: Inuktitut concept where heart-life dies to arctic community joy and land-based pleasure fundamental to Inuit culture

synsets.definition: State where the py'a (heart-soul) dies, losing capacity to feel joy in ayvu rapyta (sacred language) and community harmony
synsets.cultural_note: Guaraní concept where heart-soul dies to sacred linguistic joy and community harmony central to Guaraní spirituality
